title: A bill to provide grants for use by rural local educational agencies in purchasing new school buses.
content: Bus Utility and Safety in School Transportation Opportunity and Purchasing Act of 2005 - Directs the Secretary of Education to provide grants, on a competitive basis, to rural local educational agencies (LEAs) to pay the federal share (75) of costs of purchasing new school buses. Requires the Secretary, in providing such grants, to give priority to rural LEAs that: (1) are transporting students in a bus manufactured before 1977, (2) have a grossly depleted fleet of school buses. Or (3) serve a school required by law to provide transportation to students to enable them to transfer to another public school served by the rural LEA.
